meanings.definition: A person or thing that emasculates.
meanings.sent1: The emasculators of his confidence were harsh words from his peers.
meanings.sent2: The teacher who constantly belittles his students is an example of an emasculators.
meanings.sent3: The emasculators of the party were the boring music and lack of snacks.
meanings.sent4: Her sharp criticism acted as emasculators, stripping away his self-assurance.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds looming overhead served as emasculators, casting a shadow over the cheerful picnic.

meanings.definition: A surgical instrument used for castration.
meanings.sent1: The farmer used emasculators to castrate the young bull.
meanings.sent2: The veterinarian's toolkit included a pair of emasculators for surgical procedures.
meanings.sent3: The emasculators gleamed under the bright lights of the operating room.
meanings.sent4: The emasculators in the hands of the skilled surgeon ensured a successful procedure.
meanings.sent5: The metallic clang of the emasculators echoed in the sterile room, signaling the beginning of the surgery.

meanings.definition: A chemical agent that causes sterilization.
meanings.sent1: The laboratory developed a new type of emasculators for agricultural use.
meanings.sent2: The emasculators in the pesticide effectively prevented unwanted plant growth.
meanings.sent3: The emasculators in the cleaning solution ensured a germ-free environment.
meanings.sent4: The powerful emasculators in the formula eliminated all traces of bacteria.
meanings.sent5: The distinct smell of the emasculators lingered in the air after the disinfection process.
